verses.roman:
jhañjhāvāta-prāya āmi śloka paḍila
tāra madhye śloka tumi kaiche kaṇṭhe kaila

synonyms: jhañjhā-vāta—the strong wind of a storm; prāya—like; āmi—I; śloka—verses; paḍila—recited; tāra—of them; madhye—in the midst; śloka—one verse; tumi—You; kaiche—how; kaṇṭhe—within the heart; kaila—have taken.
translation: "I recited all the verses like the blowing wind. How could You completely learn by heart even one among those verses?"
